Sure, here are some fun and engaging activities that can build positive sibling relationships:

1. Family game night: Host a family game night where everyone gets to choose one game to play. This allows each sibling to have a turn choosing and leading the activity.

2. Cook together: Pick a meal or a dessert to cook together. Assign different tasks to each sibling and work together as a team.

3. Outdoor activities: Plan a family hike, bike ride or picnic. This can create a bonding experience by enjoying nature together.

4. Talent show: Host a family talent show that can be fun and funny. Each sibling can showcase their talents, which can be a great way to build self-esteem and mutual appreciation for each other's talents.

5. Volunteering: Encourage siblings to volunteer together, such as at a local food bank or animal shelter. This can teach siblings to work together and make a positive impact on the community.

6. DIY projects: Give siblings a DIY project that they can work on together, such as building a birdhouse or a garden planter.

7. Exercise together: Encourage siblings to exercise together, such as going for a run or doing yoga. This can create a shared interest and lead to better communication and understanding.
